00023 /*
00024 
00025 
00026 THE ALGORITHM
00027 -------------
00028 
00029 solve A*x = b+w, with x and w subject to certain LCP conditions.
00030 each x(i),w(i) must lie on one of the three line segments in the following
00031 diagram. each line segment corresponds to one index set :
00032 
00033      w(i)
00034      /|\      |           :
00035       |       |           :
00036       |       |i in N     :
00037   w>0 |       |state[i]=0 :
00038       |       |           :
00039       |       |           :  i in C
00040   w=0 +       +-----------------------+
00041       |                   :           |
00042       |                   :           |
00043   w<0 |                   :           |i in N
00044       |                   :           |state[i]=1
00045       |                   :           |
00046       |                   :           |
00047       +-------|-----------|-----------|----------> x(i)
00048              lo           0           hi
00049 
00050 the Dantzig algorithm proceeds as follows:
00051   for i=1:n
00052     * if (x(i),w(i)) is not on the line, push x(i) and w(i) positive or
00053       negative towards the line. as this is done, the other (x(j),w(j))
00054       for j<i are constrained to be on the line. if any (x,w) reaches the
00055       end of a line segment then it is switched between index sets.
00056     * i is added to the appropriate index set depending on what line segment
00057       it hits.
00058 
00059 we restrict lo(i) <= 0 and hi(i) >= 0. this makes the algorithm a bit
00060 simpler, because the starting point for x(i),w(i) is always on the dotted
00061 line x=0 and x will only ever increase in one direction, so it can only hit
00062 two out of the three line segments.
00063 
00064 
00065 NOTES
00066 -----
00067 
00068 this is an implementation of "lcp_dantzig2_ldlt.m" and "lcp_dantzig_lohi.m".
00069 the implementation is split into an LCP problem object (btLCP) and an LCP
00070 driver function. most optimization occurs in the btLCP object.
00071 
00072 a naive implementation of the algorithm requires either a lot of data motion
00073 or a lot of permutation-array lookup, because we are constantly re-ordering
00074 rows and columns. to avoid this and make a more optimized algorithm, a
00075 non-trivial data structure is used to represent the matrix A (this is
00076 implemented in the fast version of the btLCP object).
00077 
00078 during execution of this algorithm, some indexes in A are clamped (set C),
00079 some are non-clamped (set N), and some are "don't care" (where x=0).
00080 A,x,b,w (and other problem vectors) are permuted such that the clamped
00081 indexes are first, the unclamped indexes are next, and the don't-care
00082 indexes are last. this permutation is recorded in the array `p'.
00083 initially p = 0..n-1, and as the rows and columns of A,x,b,w are swapped,
00084 the corresponding elements of p are swapped.
00085 
00086 because the C and N elements are grouped together in the rows of A, we can do
00087 lots of work with a fast dot product function. if A,x,etc were not permuted
00088 and we only had a permutation array, then those dot products would be much
00089 slower as we would have a permutation array lookup in some inner loops.
00090 
00091 A is accessed through an array of row pointers, so that element (i,j) of the
00092 permuted matrix is A[i][j]. this makes row swapping fast. for column swapping
00093 we still have to actually move the data.
00094 
00095 during execution of this algorithm we maintain an L*D*L' factorization of
00096 the clamped submatrix of A (call it `AC') which is the top left nC*nC
00097 submatrix of A. there are two ways we could arrange the rows/columns in AC.
00098 
00099 (1) AC is always permuted such that L*D*L' = AC. this causes a problem
00100 when a row/column is removed from C, because then all the rows/columns of A
00101 between the deleted index and the end of C need to be rotated downward.
00102 this results in a lot of data motion and slows things down.
00103 (2) L*D*L' is actually a factorization of a *permutation* of AC (which is
00104 itself a permutation of the underlying A). this is what we do - the
00105 permutation is recorded in the vector C. call this permutation A[C,C].
00106 when a row/column is removed from C, all we have to do is swap two
00107 rows/columns and manipulate C.
00108 
00109 */
00110 
00111 
00112 #include "btDantzigLCP.h"
00113 
00114 #include <string.h>//memcpy
00115 
00116 bool s_error = false;

00138 /* solve L*X=B, with B containing 1 right hand sides.
00139  * L is an n*n lower triangular matrix with ones on the diagonal.
00140  * L is stored by rows and its leading dimension is lskip.
00141  * B is an n*1 matrix that contains the right hand sides.
00142  * B is stored by columns and its leading dimension is also lskip.
00143  * B is overwritten with X.
00144  * this processes blocks of 2*2.
00145  * if this is in the factorizer source file, n must be a multiple of 2.
00146  */
00147 
00148 static void btSolveL1_1 (const btScalar *L, btScalar *B, int n, int lskip1)
00149 {  
00150   /* declare variables - Z matrix, p and q vectors, etc */
00151   btScalar Z11,m11,Z21,m21,p1,q1,p2,*ex;
00152   const btScalar *ell;
00153   int i,j;
00154   /* compute all 2 x 1 blocks of X */
00155   for (i=0; i < n; i+=2) {
00156     /* compute all 2 x 1 block of X, from rows i..i+2-1 */
00157     /* set the Z matrix to 0 */
00158     Z11=0;
00159     Z21=0;
00160     ell = L + i*lskip1;
00161     ex = B;
00162     /* the inner loop that computes outer products and adds them to Z */
00163     for (j=i-2; j >= 0; j -= 2) {
00164       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00165       p1=ell[0];
00166       q1=ex[0];
00167       m11 = p1 * q1;
00168       p2=ell[lskip1];
00169       m21 = p2 * q1;
00170       Z11 += m11;
00171       Z21 += m21;
00172       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00173       p1=ell[1];
00174       q1=ex[1];
00175       m11 = p1 * q1;
00176       p2=ell[1+lskip1];
00177       m21 = p2 * q1;
00178       /* advance pointers */
00179       ell += 2;
00180       ex += 2;
00181       Z11 += m11;
00182       Z21 += m21;
00183       /* end of inner loop */
00184     }
00185     /* compute left-over iterations */
00186     j += 2;
00187     for (; j > 0; j--) {
00188       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00189       p1=ell[0];
00190       q1=ex[0];
00191       m11 = p1 * q1;
00192       p2=ell[lskip1];
00193       m21 = p2 * q1;
00194       /* advance pointers */
00195       ell += 1;
00196       ex += 1;
00197       Z11 += m11;
00198       Z21 += m21;
00199     }
00200     /* finish computing the X(i) block */
00201     Z11 = ex[0] - Z11;
00202     ex[0] = Z11;
00203     p1 = ell[lskip1];
00204     Z21 = ex[1] - Z21 - p1*Z11;
00205     ex[1] = Z21;
00206     /* end of outer loop */
00207   }
00208 }
00209 
00210 /* solve L*X=B, with B containing 2 right hand sides.
00211  * L is an n*n lower triangular matrix with ones on the diagonal.
00212  * L is stored by rows and its leading dimension is lskip.
00213  * B is an n*2 matrix that contains the right hand sides.
00214  * B is stored by columns and its leading dimension is also lskip.
00215  * B is overwritten with X.
00216  * this processes blocks of 2*2.
00217  * if this is in the factorizer source file, n must be a multiple of 2.
00218  */
00219 
00220 static void btSolveL1_2 (const btScalar *L, btScalar *B, int n, int lskip1)
00221 {  
00222   /* declare variables - Z matrix, p and q vectors, etc */
00223   btScalar Z11,m11,Z12,m12,Z21,m21,Z22,m22,p1,q1,p2,q2,*ex;
00224   const btScalar *ell;
00225   int i,j;
00226   /* compute all 2 x 2 blocks of X */
00227   for (i=0; i < n; i+=2) {
00228     /* compute all 2 x 2 block of X, from rows i..i+2-1 */
00229     /* set the Z matrix to 0 */
00230     Z11=0;
00231     Z12=0;
00232     Z21=0;
00233     Z22=0;
00234     ell = L + i*lskip1;
00235     ex = B;
00236     /* the inner loop that computes outer products and adds them to Z */
00237     for (j=i-2; j >= 0; j -= 2) {
00238       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00239       p1=ell[0];
00240       q1=ex[0];
00241       m11 = p1 * q1;
00242       q2=ex[lskip1];
00243       m12 = p1 * q2;
00244       p2=ell[lskip1];
00245       m21 = p2 * q1;
00246       m22 = p2 * q2;
00247       Z11 += m11;
00248       Z12 += m12;
00249       Z21 += m21;
00250       Z22 += m22;
00251       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00252       p1=ell[1];
00253       q1=ex[1];
00254       m11 = p1 * q1;
00255       q2=ex[1+lskip1];
00256       m12 = p1 * q2;
00257       p2=ell[1+lskip1];
00258       m21 = p2 * q1;
00259       m22 = p2 * q2;
00260       /* advance pointers */
00261       ell += 2;
00262       ex += 2;
00263       Z11 += m11;
00264       Z12 += m12;
00265       Z21 += m21;
00266       Z22 += m22;
00267       /* end of inner loop */
00268     }
00269     /* compute left-over iterations */
00270     j += 2;
00271     for (; j > 0; j--) {
00272       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00273       p1=ell[0];
00274       q1=ex[0];
00275       m11 = p1 * q1;
00276       q2=ex[lskip1];
00277       m12 = p1 * q2;
00278       p2=ell[lskip1];
00279       m21 = p2 * q1;
00280       m22 = p2 * q2;
00281       /* advance pointers */
00282       ell += 1;
00283       ex += 1;
00284       Z11 += m11;
00285       Z12 += m12;
00286       Z21 += m21;
00287       Z22 += m22;
00288     }
00289     /* finish computing the X(i) block */
00290     Z11 = ex[0] - Z11;
00291     ex[0] = Z11;
00292     Z12 = ex[lskip1] - Z12;
00293     ex[lskip1] = Z12;
00294     p1 = ell[lskip1];
00295     Z21 = ex[1] - Z21 - p1*Z11;
00296     ex[1] = Z21;
00297     Z22 = ex[1+lskip1] - Z22 - p1*Z12;
00298     ex[1+lskip1] = Z22;
00299     /* end of outer loop */
00300   }
00301 }
00302 
00303 
00304 void btFactorLDLT (btScalar *A, btScalar *d, int n, int nskip1)
00305 {  
00306   int i,j;
00307   btScalar sum,*ell,*dee,dd,p1,p2,q1,q2,Z11,m11,Z21,m21,Z22,m22;
00308   if (n < 1) return;
00309   
00310   for (i=0; i<=n-2; i += 2) {
00311     /* solve L*(D*l)=a, l is scaled elements in 2 x i block at A(i,0) */
00312     btSolveL1_2 (A,A+i*nskip1,i,nskip1);
00313     /* scale the elements in a 2 x i block at A(i,0), and also */
00314     /* compute Z = the outer product matrix that we'll need. */
00315     Z11 = 0;
00316     Z21 = 0;
00317     Z22 = 0;
00318     ell = A+i*nskip1;
00319     dee = d;
00320     for (j=i-6; j >= 0; j -= 6) {
00321       p1 = ell[0];
00322       p2 = ell[nskip1];
00323       dd = dee[0];
00324       q1 = p1*dd;
00325       q2 = p2*dd;
00326       ell[0] = q1;
00327       ell[nskip1] = q2;
00328       m11 = p1*q1;
00329       m21 = p2*q1;
00330       m22 = p2*q2;
00331       Z11 += m11;
00332       Z21 += m21;
00333       Z22 += m22;
00334       p1 = ell[1];
00335       p2 = ell[1+nskip1];
00336       dd = dee[1];
00337       q1 = p1*dd;
00338       q2 = p2*dd;
00339       ell[1] = q1;
00340       ell[1+nskip1] = q2;
00341       m11 = p1*q1;
00342       m21 = p2*q1;
00343       m22 = p2*q2;
00344       Z11 += m11;
00345       Z21 += m21;
00346       Z22 += m22;
00347       p1 = ell[2];
00348       p2 = ell[2+nskip1];
00349       dd = dee[2];
00350       q1 = p1*dd;
00351       q2 = p2*dd;
00352       ell[2] = q1;
00353       ell[2+nskip1] = q2;
00354       m11 = p1*q1;
00355       m21 = p2*q1;
00356       m22 = p2*q2;
00357       Z11 += m11;
00358       Z21 += m21;
00359       Z22 += m22;
00360       p1 = ell[3];
00361       p2 = ell[3+nskip1];
00362       dd = dee[3];
00363       q1 = p1*dd;
00364       q2 = p2*dd;
00365       ell[3] = q1;
00366       ell[3+nskip1] = q2;
00367       m11 = p1*q1;
00368       m21 = p2*q1;
00369       m22 = p2*q2;
00370       Z11 += m11;
00371       Z21 += m21;
00372       Z22 += m22;
00373       p1 = ell[4];
00374       p2 = ell[4+nskip1];
00375       dd = dee[4];
00376       q1 = p1*dd;
00377       q2 = p2*dd;
00378       ell[4] = q1;
00379       ell[4+nskip1] = q2;
00380       m11 = p1*q1;
00381       m21 = p2*q1;
00382       m22 = p2*q2;
00383       Z11 += m11;
00384       Z21 += m21;
00385       Z22 += m22;
00386       p1 = ell[5];
00387       p2 = ell[5+nskip1];
00388       dd = dee[5];
00389       q1 = p1*dd;
00390       q2 = p2*dd;
00391       ell[5] = q1;
00392       ell[5+nskip1] = q2;
00393       m11 = p1*q1;
00394       m21 = p2*q1;
00395       m22 = p2*q2;
00396       Z11 += m11;
00397       Z21 += m21;
00398       Z22 += m22;
00399       ell += 6;
00400       dee += 6;
00401     }
00402     /* compute left-over iterations */
00403     j += 6;
00404     for (; j > 0; j--) {
00405       p1 = ell[0];
00406       p2 = ell[nskip1];
00407       dd = dee[0];
00408       q1 = p1*dd;
00409       q2 = p2*dd;
00410       ell[0] = q1;
00411       ell[nskip1] = q2;
00412       m11 = p1*q1;
00413       m21 = p2*q1;
00414       m22 = p2*q2;
00415       Z11 += m11;
00416       Z21 += m21;
00417       Z22 += m22;
00418       ell++;
00419       dee++;
00420     }
00421     /* solve for diagonal 2 x 2 block at A(i,i) */
00422     Z11 = ell[0] - Z11;
00423     Z21 = ell[nskip1] - Z21;
00424     Z22 = ell[1+nskip1] - Z22;
00425     dee = d + i;
00426     /* factorize 2 x 2 block Z,dee */
00427     /* factorize row 1 */
00428     dee[0] = btRecip(Z11);
00429     /* factorize row 2 */
00430     sum = 0;
00431     q1 = Z21;
00432     q2 = q1 * dee[0];
00433     Z21 = q2;
00434     sum += q1*q2;
00435     dee[1] = btRecip(Z22 - sum);
00436     /* done factorizing 2 x 2 block */
00437     ell[nskip1] = Z21;
00438   }
00439   /* compute the (less than 2) rows at the bottom */
00440   switch (n-i) {
00441     case 0:
00442     break;
00443     
00444     case 1:
00445     btSolveL1_1 (A,A+i*nskip1,i,nskip1);
00446     /* scale the elements in a 1 x i block at A(i,0), and also */
00447     /* compute Z = the outer product matrix that we'll need. */
00448     Z11 = 0;
00449     ell = A+i*nskip1;
00450     dee = d;
00451     for (j=i-6; j >= 0; j -= 6) {
00452       p1 = ell[0];
00453       dd = dee[0];
00454       q1 = p1*dd;
00455       ell[0] = q1;
00456       m11 = p1*q1;
00457       Z11 += m11;
00458       p1 = ell[1];
00459       dd = dee[1];
00460       q1 = p1*dd;
00461       ell[1] = q1;
00462       m11 = p1*q1;
00463       Z11 += m11;
00464       p1 = ell[2];
00465       dd = dee[2];
00466       q1 = p1*dd;
00467       ell[2] = q1;
00468       m11 = p1*q1;
00469       Z11 += m11;
00470       p1 = ell[3];
00471       dd = dee[3];
00472       q1 = p1*dd;
00473       ell[3] = q1;
00474       m11 = p1*q1;
00475       Z11 += m11;
00476       p1 = ell[4];
00477       dd = dee[4];
00478       q1 = p1*dd;
00479       ell[4] = q1;
00480       m11 = p1*q1;
00481       Z11 += m11;
00482       p1 = ell[5];
00483       dd = dee[5];
00484       q1 = p1*dd;
00485       ell[5] = q1;
00486       m11 = p1*q1;
00487       Z11 += m11;
00488       ell += 6;
00489       dee += 6;
00490     }
00491     /* compute left-over iterations */
00492     j += 6;
00493     for (; j > 0; j--) {
00494       p1 = ell[0];
00495       dd = dee[0];
00496       q1 = p1*dd;
00497       ell[0] = q1;
00498       m11 = p1*q1;
00499       Z11 += m11;
00500       ell++;
00501       dee++;
00502     }
00503     /* solve for diagonal 1 x 1 block at A(i,i) */
00504     Z11 = ell[0] - Z11;
00505     dee = d + i;
00506     /* factorize 1 x 1 block Z,dee */
00507     /* factorize row 1 */
00508     dee[0] = btRecip(Z11);
00509     /* done factorizing 1 x 1 block */
00510     break;
00511     
00512     //default: *((char*)0)=0;  /* this should never happen! */
00513   }
00514 }
00515 
00516 /* solve L*X=B, with B containing 1 right hand sides.
00517  * L is an n*n lower triangular matrix with ones on the diagonal.
00518  * L is stored by rows and its leading dimension is lskip.
00519  * B is an n*1 matrix that contains the right hand sides.
00520  * B is stored by columns and its leading dimension is also lskip.
00521  * B is overwritten with X.
00522  * this processes blocks of 4*4.
00523  * if this is in the factorizer source file, n must be a multiple of 4.
00524  */
00525 
00526 void btSolveL1 (const btScalar *L, btScalar *B, int n, int lskip1)
00527 {  
00528   /* declare variables - Z matrix, p and q vectors, etc */
00529   btScalar Z11,Z21,Z31,Z41,p1,q1,p2,p3,p4,*ex;
00530   const btScalar *ell;
00531   int lskip2,lskip3,i,j;
00532   /* compute lskip values */
00533   lskip2 = 2*lskip1;
00534   lskip3 = 3*lskip1;
00535   /* compute all 4 x 1 blocks of X */
00536   for (i=0; i <= n-4; i+=4) {
00537     /* compute all 4 x 1 block of X, from rows i..i+4-1 */
00538     /* set the Z matrix to 0 */
00539     Z11=0;
00540     Z21=0;
00541     Z31=0;
00542     Z41=0;
00543     ell = L + i*lskip1;
00544     ex = B;
00545     /* the inner loop that computes outer products and adds them to Z */
00546     for (j=i-12; j >= 0; j -= 12) {
00547       /* load p and q values */
00548       p1=ell[0];
00549       q1=ex[0];
00550       p2=ell[lskip1];
00551       p3=ell[lskip2];
00552       p4=ell[lskip3];
00553       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00554       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00555       Z21 += p2 * q1;
00556       Z31 += p3 * q1;
00557       Z41 += p4 * q1;
00558       /* load p and q values */
00559       p1=ell[1];
00560       q1=ex[1];
00561       p2=ell[1+lskip1];
00562       p3=ell[1+lskip2];
00563       p4=ell[1+lskip3];
00564       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00565       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00566       Z21 += p2 * q1;
00567       Z31 += p3 * q1;
00568       Z41 += p4 * q1;
00569       /* load p and q values */
00570       p1=ell[2];
00571       q1=ex[2];
00572       p2=ell[2+lskip1];
00573       p3=ell[2+lskip2];
00574       p4=ell[2+lskip3];
00575       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00576       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00577       Z21 += p2 * q1;
00578       Z31 += p3 * q1;
00579       Z41 += p4 * q1;
00580       /* load p and q values */
00581       p1=ell[3];
00582       q1=ex[3];
00583       p2=ell[3+lskip1];
00584       p3=ell[3+lskip2];
00585       p4=ell[3+lskip3];
00586       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00587       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00588       Z21 += p2 * q1;
00589       Z31 += p3 * q1;
00590       Z41 += p4 * q1;
00591       /* load p and q values */
00592       p1=ell[4];
00593       q1=ex[4];
00594       p2=ell[4+lskip1];
00595       p3=ell[4+lskip2];
00596       p4=ell[4+lskip3];
00597       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00598       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00599       Z21 += p2 * q1;
00600       Z31 += p3 * q1;
00601       Z41 += p4 * q1;
00602       /* load p and q values */
00603       p1=ell[5];
00604       q1=ex[5];
00605       p2=ell[5+lskip1];
00606       p3=ell[5+lskip2];
00607       p4=ell[5+lskip3];
00608       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00609       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00610       Z21 += p2 * q1;
00611       Z31 += p3 * q1;
00612       Z41 += p4 * q1;
00613       /* load p and q values */
00614       p1=ell[6];
00615       q1=ex[6];
00616       p2=ell[6+lskip1];
00617       p3=ell[6+lskip2];
00618       p4=ell[6+lskip3];
00619       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00620       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00621       Z21 += p2 * q1;
00622       Z31 += p3 * q1;
00623       Z41 += p4 * q1;
00624       /* load p and q values */
00625       p1=ell[7];
00626       q1=ex[7];
00627       p2=ell[7+lskip1];
00628       p3=ell[7+lskip2];
00629       p4=ell[7+lskip3];
00630       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00631       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00632       Z21 += p2 * q1;
00633       Z31 += p3 * q1;
00634       Z41 += p4 * q1;
00635       /* load p and q values */
00636       p1=ell[8];
00637       q1=ex[8];
00638       p2=ell[8+lskip1];
00639       p3=ell[8+lskip2];
00640       p4=ell[8+lskip3];
00641       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00642       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00643       Z21 += p2 * q1;
00644       Z31 += p3 * q1;
00645       Z41 += p4 * q1;
00646       /* load p and q values */
00647       p1=ell[9];
00648       q1=ex[9];
00649       p2=ell[9+lskip1];
00650       p3=ell[9+lskip2];
00651       p4=ell[9+lskip3];
00652       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00653       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00654       Z21 += p2 * q1;
00655       Z31 += p3 * q1;
00656       Z41 += p4 * q1;
00657       /* load p and q values */
00658       p1=ell[10];
00659       q1=ex[10];
00660       p2=ell[10+lskip1];
00661       p3=ell[10+lskip2];
00662       p4=ell[10+lskip3];
00663       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00664       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00665       Z21 += p2 * q1;
00666       Z31 += p3 * q1;
00667       Z41 += p4 * q1;
00668       /* load p and q values */
00669       p1=ell[11];
00670       q1=ex[11];
00671       p2=ell[11+lskip1];
00672       p3=ell[11+lskip2];
00673       p4=ell[11+lskip3];
00674       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00675       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00676       Z21 += p2 * q1;
00677       Z31 += p3 * q1;
00678       Z41 += p4 * q1;
00679       /* advance pointers */
00680       ell += 12;
00681       ex += 12;
00682       /* end of inner loop */
00683     }
00684     /* compute left-over iterations */
00685     j += 12;
00686     for (; j > 0; j--) {
00687       /* load p and q values */
00688       p1=ell[0];
00689       q1=ex[0];
00690       p2=ell[lskip1];
00691       p3=ell[lskip2];
00692       p4=ell[lskip3];
00693       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00694       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00695       Z21 += p2 * q1;
00696       Z31 += p3 * q1;
00697       Z41 += p4 * q1;
00698       /* advance pointers */
00699       ell += 1;
00700       ex += 1;
00701     }
00702     /* finish computing the X(i) block */
00703     Z11 = ex[0] - Z11;
00704     ex[0] = Z11;
00705     p1 = ell[lskip1];
00706     Z21 = ex[1] - Z21 - p1*Z11;
00707     ex[1] = Z21;
00708     p1 = ell[lskip2];
00709     p2 = ell[1+lskip2];
00710     Z31 = ex[2] - Z31 - p1*Z11 - p2*Z21;
00711     ex[2] = Z31;
00712     p1 = ell[lskip3];
00713     p2 = ell[1+lskip3];
00714     p3 = ell[2+lskip3];
00715     Z41 = ex[3] - Z41 - p1*Z11 - p2*Z21 - p3*Z31;
00716     ex[3] = Z41;
00717     /* end of outer loop */
00718   }
00719   /* compute rows at end that are not a multiple of block size */
00720   for (; i < n; i++) {
00721     /* compute all 1 x 1 block of X, from rows i..i+1-1 */
00722     /* set the Z matrix to 0 */
00723     Z11=0;
00724     ell = L + i*lskip1;
00725     ex = B;
00726     /* the inner loop that computes outer products and adds them to Z */
00727     for (j=i-12; j >= 0; j -= 12) {
00728       /* load p and q values */
00729       p1=ell[0];
00730       q1=ex[0];
00731       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00732       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00733       /* load p and q values */
00734       p1=ell[1];
00735       q1=ex[1];
00736       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00737       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00738       /* load p and q values */
00739       p1=ell[2];
00740       q1=ex[2];
00741       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00742       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00743       /* load p and q values */
00744       p1=ell[3];
00745       q1=ex[3];
00746       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00747       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00748       /* load p and q values */
00749       p1=ell[4];
00750       q1=ex[4];
00751       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00752       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00753       /* load p and q values */
00754       p1=ell[5];
00755       q1=ex[5];
00756       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00757       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00758       /* load p and q values */
00759       p1=ell[6];
00760       q1=ex[6];
00761       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00762       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00763       /* load p and q values */
00764       p1=ell[7];
00765       q1=ex[7];
00766       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00767       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00768       /* load p and q values */
00769       p1=ell[8];
00770       q1=ex[8];
00771       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00772       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00773       /* load p and q values */
00774       p1=ell[9];
00775       q1=ex[9];
00776       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00777       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00778       /* load p and q values */
00779       p1=ell[10];
00780       q1=ex[10];
00781       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00782       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00783       /* load p and q values */
00784       p1=ell[11];
00785       q1=ex[11];
00786       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00787       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00788       /* advance pointers */
00789       ell += 12;
00790       ex += 12;
00791       /* end of inner loop */
00792     }
00793     /* compute left-over iterations */
00794     j += 12;
00795     for (; j > 0; j--) {
00796       /* load p and q values */
00797       p1=ell[0];
00798       q1=ex[0];
00799       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00800       Z11 += p1 * q1;
00801       /* advance pointers */
00802       ell += 1;
00803       ex += 1;
00804     }
00805     /* finish computing the X(i) block */
00806     Z11 = ex[0] - Z11;
00807     ex[0] = Z11;
00808   }
00809 }
00810 
00811 /* solve L^T * x=b, with b containing 1 right hand side.
00812  * L is an n*n lower triangular matrix with ones on the diagonal.
00813  * L is stored by rows and its leading dimension is lskip.
00814  * b is an n*1 matrix that contains the right hand side.
00815  * b is overwritten with x.
00816  * this processes blocks of 4.
00817  */
00818 
00819 void btSolveL1T (const btScalar *L, btScalar *B, int n, int lskip1)
00820 {  
00821   /* declare variables - Z matrix, p and q vectors, etc */
00822   btScalar Z11,m11,Z21,m21,Z31,m31,Z41,m41,p1,q1,p2,p3,p4,*ex;
00823   const btScalar *ell;
00824   int lskip2,i,j;
00825 //  int lskip3;
00826   /* special handling for L and B because we're solving L1 *transpose* */
00827   L = L + (n-1)*(lskip1+1);
00828   B = B + n-1;
00829   lskip1 = -lskip1;
00830   /* compute lskip values */
00831   lskip2 = 2*lskip1;
00832   //lskip3 = 3*lskip1;
00833   /* compute all 4 x 1 blocks of X */
00834   for (i=0; i <= n-4; i+=4) {
00835     /* compute all 4 x 1 block of X, from rows i..i+4-1 */
00836     /* set the Z matrix to 0 */
00837     Z11=0;
00838     Z21=0;
00839     Z31=0;
00840     Z41=0;
00841     ell = L - i;
00842     ex = B;
00843     /* the inner loop that computes outer products and adds them to Z */
00844     for (j=i-4; j >= 0; j -= 4) {
00845       /* load p and q values */
00846       p1=ell[0];
00847       q1=ex[0];
00848       p2=ell[-1];
00849       p3=ell[-2];
00850       p4=ell[-3];
00851       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00852       m11 = p1 * q1;
00853       m21 = p2 * q1;
00854       m31 = p3 * q1;
00855       m41 = p4 * q1;
00856       ell += lskip1;
00857       Z11 += m11;
00858       Z21 += m21;
00859       Z31 += m31;
00860       Z41 += m41;
00861       /* load p and q values */
00862       p1=ell[0];
00863       q1=ex[-1];
00864       p2=ell[-1];
00865       p3=ell[-2];
00866       p4=ell[-3];
00867       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00868       m11 = p1 * q1;
00869       m21 = p2 * q1;
00870       m31 = p3 * q1;
00871       m41 = p4 * q1;
00872       ell += lskip1;
00873       Z11 += m11;
00874       Z21 += m21;
00875       Z31 += m31;
00876       Z41 += m41;
00877       /* load p and q values */
00878       p1=ell[0];
00879       q1=ex[-2];
00880       p2=ell[-1];
00881       p3=ell[-2];
00882       p4=ell[-3];
00883       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00884       m11 = p1 * q1;
00885       m21 = p2 * q1;
00886       m31 = p3 * q1;
00887       m41 = p4 * q1;
00888       ell += lskip1;
00889       Z11 += m11;
00890       Z21 += m21;
00891       Z31 += m31;
00892       Z41 += m41;
00893       /* load p and q values */
00894       p1=ell[0];
00895       q1=ex[-3];
00896       p2=ell[-1];
00897       p3=ell[-2];
00898       p4=ell[-3];
00899       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00900       m11 = p1 * q1;
00901       m21 = p2 * q1;
00902       m31 = p3 * q1;
00903       m41 = p4 * q1;
00904       ell += lskip1;
00905       ex -= 4;
00906       Z11 += m11;
00907       Z21 += m21;
00908       Z31 += m31;
00909       Z41 += m41;
00910       /* end of inner loop */
00911     }
00912     /* compute left-over iterations */
00913     j += 4;
00914     for (; j > 0; j--) {
00915       /* load p and q values */
00916       p1=ell[0];
00917       q1=ex[0];
00918       p2=ell[-1];
00919       p3=ell[-2];
00920       p4=ell[-3];
00921       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00922       m11 = p1 * q1;
00923       m21 = p2 * q1;
00924       m31 = p3 * q1;
00925       m41 = p4 * q1;
00926       ell += lskip1;
00927       ex -= 1;
00928       Z11 += m11;
00929       Z21 += m21;
00930       Z31 += m31;
00931       Z41 += m41;
00932     }
00933     /* finish computing the X(i) block */
00934     Z11 = ex[0] - Z11;
00935     ex[0] = Z11;
00936     p1 = ell[-1];
00937     Z21 = ex[-1] - Z21 - p1*Z11;
00938     ex[-1] = Z21;
00939     p1 = ell[-2];
00940     p2 = ell[-2+lskip1];
00941     Z31 = ex[-2] - Z31 - p1*Z11 - p2*Z21;
00942     ex[-2] = Z31;
00943     p1 = ell[-3];
00944     p2 = ell[-3+lskip1];
00945     p3 = ell[-3+lskip2];
00946     Z41 = ex[-3] - Z41 - p1*Z11 - p2*Z21 - p3*Z31;
00947     ex[-3] = Z41;
00948     /* end of outer loop */
00949   }
00950   /* compute rows at end that are not a multiple of block size */
00951   for (; i < n; i++) {
00952     /* compute all 1 x 1 block of X, from rows i..i+1-1 */
00953     /* set the Z matrix to 0 */
00954     Z11=0;
00955     ell = L - i;
00956     ex = B;
00957     /* the inner loop that computes outer products and adds them to Z */
00958     for (j=i-4; j >= 0; j -= 4) {
00959       /* load p and q values */
00960       p1=ell[0];
00961       q1=ex[0];
00962       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00963       m11 = p1 * q1;
00964       ell += lskip1;
00965       Z11 += m11;
00966       /* load p and q values */
00967       p1=ell[0];
00968       q1=ex[-1];
00969       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00970       m11 = p1 * q1;
00971       ell += lskip1;
00972       Z11 += m11;
00973       /* load p and q values */
00974       p1=ell[0];
00975       q1=ex[-2];
00976       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00977       m11 = p1 * q1;
00978       ell += lskip1;
00979       Z11 += m11;
00980       /* load p and q values */
00981       p1=ell[0];
00982       q1=ex[-3];
00983       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00984       m11 = p1 * q1;
00985       ell += lskip1;
00986       ex -= 4;
00987       Z11 += m11;
00988       /* end of inner loop */
00989     }
00990     /* compute left-over iterations */
00991     j += 4;
00992     for (; j > 0; j--) {
00993       /* load p and q values */
00994       p1=ell[0];
00995       q1=ex[0];
00996       /* compute outer product and add it to the Z matrix */
00997       m11 = p1 * q1;
00998       ell += lskip1;
00999       ex -= 1;
01000       Z11 += m11;
01001     }
01002     /* finish computing the X(i) block */
01003     Z11 = ex[0] - Z11;
01004     ex[0] = Z11;
01005   }
01006 }
01007 
01008 
01009 
01010 void btVectorScale (btScalar *a, const btScalar *d, int n)
01011 {
01012   btAssert (a && d && n >= 0);
01013   for (int i=0; i<n; i++) {
01014     a[i] *= d[i];
01015   }
01016 }
01017 
01018 void btSolveLDLT (const btScalar *L, const btScalar *d, btScalar *b, int n, int nskip)
01019 {
01020   btAssert (L && d && b && n > 0 && nskip >= n);
01021   btSolveL1 (L,b,n,nskip);
01022   btVectorScale (b,d,n);
01023   btSolveL1T (L,b,n,nskip);
01024 }
01025 
01026 
01027 
01028 //***************************************************************************
01029 
01030 // swap row/column i1 with i2 in the n*n matrix A. the leading dimension of
01031 // A is nskip. this only references and swaps the lower triangle.
01032 // if `do_fast_row_swaps' is nonzero and row pointers are being used, then
01033 // rows will be swapped by exchanging row pointers. otherwise the data will
01034 // be copied.
01035 
01036 static void btSwapRowsAndCols (BTATYPE A, int n, int i1, int i2, int nskip, 
01037   int do_fast_row_swaps)
01038 {
01039   btAssert (A && n > 0 && i1 >= 0 && i2 >= 0 && i1 < n && i2 < n &&
01040     nskip >= n && i1 < i2);
01041 
01042 # ifdef BTROWPTRS
01043   btScalar *A_i1 = A[i1];
01044   btScalar *A_i2 = A[i2];
01045   for (int i=i1+1; i<i2; ++i) {
01046     btScalar *A_i_i1 = A[i] + i1;
01047     A_i1[i] = *A_i_i1;
01048     *A_i_i1 = A_i2[i];
01049   }
01050   A_i1[i2] = A_i1[i1];
01051   A_i1[i1] = A_i2[i1];
01052   A_i2[i1] = A_i2[i2];
01053   // swap rows, by swapping row pointers
01054   if (do_fast_row_swaps) {
01055     A[i1] = A_i2;
01056     A[i2] = A_i1;
01057   }
01058   else {
01059     // Only swap till i2 column to match A plain storage variant.
01060     for (int k = 0; k <= i2; ++k) {
01061       btScalar tmp = A_i1[k];
01062       A_i1[k] = A_i2[k];
01063       A_i2[k] = tmp;
01064     }
01065   }
01066   // swap columns the hard way
01067   for (int j=i2+1; j<n; ++j) {
01068     btScalar *A_j = A[j];
01069     btScalar tmp = A_j[i1];
01070     A_j[i1] = A_j[i2];
01071     A_j[i2] = tmp;
01072   }
01073 # else
01074   btScalar *A_i1 = A+i1*nskip;
01075   btScalar *A_i2 = A+i2*nskip;
01076   for (int k = 0; k < i1; ++k) {
01077     btScalar tmp = A_i1[k];
01078     A_i1[k] = A_i2[k];
01079     A_i2[k] = tmp;
01080   }
01081   btScalar *A_i = A_i1 + nskip;
01082   for (int i=i1+1; i<i2; A_i+=nskip, ++i) {
01083     btScalar tmp = A_i2[i];
01084     A_i2[i] = A_i[i1];
01085     A_i[i1] = tmp;
01086   }
01087   {
01088     btScalar tmp = A_i1[i1];
01089     A_i1[i1] = A_i2[i2];
01090     A_i2[i2] = tmp;
01091   }
01092   btScalar *A_j = A_i2 + nskip;
01093   for (int j=i2+1; j<n; A_j+=nskip, ++j) {
01094     btScalar tmp = A_j[i1];
01095     A_j[i1] = A_j[i2];
01096     A_j[i2] = tmp;
01097   }
01098 # endif
01099 }
01100 
01101 
01102 // swap two indexes in the n*n LCP problem. i1 must be <= i2.
01103 
01104 static void btSwapProblem (BTATYPE A, btScalar *x, btScalar *b, btScalar *w, btScalar *lo,
01105                          btScalar *hi, int *p, bool *state, int *findex,
01106                          int n, int i1, int i2, int nskip,
01107                          int do_fast_row_swaps)
01108 {
01109   btScalar tmpr;
01110   int tmpi;
01111   bool tmpb;
01112   btAssert (n>0 && i1 >=0 && i2 >= 0 && i1 < n && i2 < n && nskip >= n && i1 <= i2);
01113   if (i1==i2) return;
01114   
01115   btSwapRowsAndCols (A,n,i1,i2,nskip,do_fast_row_swaps);
01116   
01117   tmpr = x[i1];
01118   x[i1] = x[i2];
01119   x[i2] = tmpr;
01120   
01121   tmpr = b[i1];
01122   b[i1] = b[i2];
01123   b[i2] = tmpr;
01124   
01125   tmpr = w[i1];
01126   w[i1] = w[i2];
01127   w[i2] = tmpr;
01128   
01129   tmpr = lo[i1];
01130   lo[i1] = lo[i2];
01131   lo[i2] = tmpr;
01132 
01133   tmpr = hi[i1];
01134   hi[i1] = hi[i2];
01135   hi[i2] = tmpr;
01136 
01137   tmpi = p[i1];
01138   p[i1] = p[i2];
01139   p[i2] = tmpi;
01140 
01141   tmpb = state[i1];
01142   state[i1] = state[i2];
01143   state[i2] = tmpb;
01144 
01145   if (findex) {
01146     tmpi = findex[i1];
01147     findex[i1] = findex[i2];
01148     findex[i2] = tmpi;
01149   }
01150 }
01151 
01152 
01153 
01154 
01155 //***************************************************************************
01156 // btLCP manipulator object. this represents an n*n LCP problem.
01157 //
01158 // two index sets C and N are kept. each set holds a subset of
01159 // the variable indexes 0..n-1. an index can only be in one set.
01160 // initially both sets are empty.
01161 //
01162 // the index set C is special: solutions to A(C,C)\A(C,i) can be generated.
01163 
01164 //***************************************************************************
01165 // fast implementation of btLCP. see the above definition of btLCP for
01166 // interface comments.
01167 //
01168 // `p' records the permutation of A,x,b,w,etc. p is initially 1:n and is
01169 // permuted as the other vectors/matrices are permuted.
01170 //
01171 // A,x,b,w,lo,hi,state,findex,p,c are permuted such that sets C,N have
01172 // contiguous indexes. the don't-care indexes follow N.
01173 //
01174 // an L*D*L' factorization is maintained of A(C,C), and whenever indexes are
01175 // added or removed from the set C the factorization is updated.
01176 // thus L*D*L'=A[C,C], i.e. a permuted top left nC*nC submatrix of A.
01177 // the leading dimension of the matrix L is always `nskip'.
01178 //
01179 // at the start there may be other indexes that are unbounded but are not
01180 // included in `nub'. btLCP will permute the matrix so that absolutely all
01181 // unbounded vectors are at the start. thus there may be some initial
01182 // permutation.
01183 //
01184 // the algorithms here assume certain patterns, particularly with respect to
01185 // index transfer.
01186 
01187 #ifdef btLCP_FAST
01188 
01189 struct btLCP 
01190 {
01191         const int m_n;
01192         const int m_nskip;
01193         int m_nub;
01194         int m_nC, m_nN;                         // size of each index set
01195         BTATYPE const m_A;                              // A rows
01196         btScalar *const m_x, * const m_b, *const m_w, *const m_lo,* const m_hi; // permuted LCP problem data
01197         btScalar *const m_L, *const m_d;                                // L*D*L' factorization of set C
01198         btScalar *const m_Dell, *const m_ell, *const m_tmp;
01199         bool *const m_state;
01200         int *const m_findex, *const m_p, *const m_C;
01201 
01202         btLCP (int _n, int _nskip, int _nub, btScalar *_Adata, btScalar *_x, btScalar *_b, btScalar *_w,
01203                 btScalar *_lo, btScalar *_hi, btScalar *l, btScalar *_d,
01204                 btScalar *_Dell, btScalar *_ell, btScalar *_tmp,
01205                 bool *_state, int *_findex, int *p, int *c, btScalar **Arows);
01206         int getNub() const { return m_nub; }
01207         void transfer_i_to_C (int i);
01208         void transfer_i_to_N (int i) { m_nN++; }                        // because we can assume C and N span 1:i-1
01209         void transfer_i_from_N_to_C (int i);
01210         void transfer_i_from_C_to_N (int i, btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar>& scratch);
01211         int numC() const { return m_nC; }
01212         int numN() const { return m_nN; }
01213         int indexC (int i) const { return i; }
01214         int indexN (int i) const { return i+m_nC; }
01215         btScalar Aii (int i) const  { return BTAROW(i)[i]; }
01216         btScalar AiC_times_qC (int i, btScalar *q) const { return btLargeDot (BTAROW(i), q, m_nC); }
01217         btScalar AiN_times_qN (int i, btScalar *q) const { return btLargeDot (BTAROW(i)+m_nC, q+m_nC, m_nN); }
01218         void pN_equals_ANC_times_qC (btScalar *p, btScalar *q);
01219         void pN_plusequals_ANi (btScalar *p, int i, int sign=1);
01220         void pC_plusequals_s_times_qC (btScalar *p, btScalar s, btScalar *q);
01221         void pN_plusequals_s_times_qN (btScalar *p, btScalar s, btScalar *q);
01222         void solve1 (btScalar *a, int i, int dir=1, int only_transfer=0);
01223         void unpermute();
01224 };
01225 
01226 
01227 btLCP::btLCP (int _n, int _nskip, int _nub, btScalar *_Adata, btScalar *_x, btScalar *_b, btScalar *_w,
01228             btScalar *_lo, btScalar *_hi, btScalar *l, btScalar *_d,
01229             btScalar *_Dell, btScalar *_ell, btScalar *_tmp,
01230             bool *_state, int *_findex, int *p, int *c, btScalar **Arows):
01231   m_n(_n), m_nskip(_nskip), m_nub(_nub), m_nC(0), m_nN(0),
01232 # ifdef BTROWPTRS
01233   m_A(Arows),
01234 #else
01235   m_A(_Adata),
01236 #endif
01237   m_x(_x), m_b(_b), m_w(_w), m_lo(_lo), m_hi(_hi),
01238   m_L(l), m_d(_d), m_Dell(_Dell), m_ell(_ell), m_tmp(_tmp),
01239   m_state(_state), m_findex(_findex), m_p(p), m_C(c)
01240 {
01241   {
01242     btSetZero (m_x,m_n);
01243   }
01244 
01245   {
01246 # ifdef BTROWPTRS
01247     // make matrix row pointers
01248     btScalar *aptr = _Adata;
01249     BTATYPE A = m_A;
01250     const int n = m_n, nskip = m_nskip;
01251     for (int k=0; k<n; aptr+=nskip, ++k) A[k] = aptr;
01252 # endif
01253   }
01254 
01255   {
01256     int *p = m_p;
01257     const int n = m_n;
01258     for (int k=0; k<n; ++k) p[k]=k;             // initially unpermuted
01259   }
01260 
01261   /*
01262   // for testing, we can do some random swaps in the area i > nub
01263   {
01264     const int n = m_n;
01265     const int nub = m_nub;
01266     if (nub < n) {
01267     for (int k=0; k<100; k++) {
01268       int i1,i2;
01269       do {
01270         i1 = dRandInt(n-nub)+nub;
01271         i2 = dRandInt(n-nub)+nub;
01272       }
01273       while (i1 > i2); 
01274       //printf ("--> %d %d\n",i1,i2);
01275       btSwapProblem (m_A,m_x,m_b,m_w,m_lo,m_hi,m_p,m_state,m_findex,n,i1,i2,m_nskip,0);
01276     }
01277   }
01278   */
01279 
01280   // permute the problem so that *all* the unbounded variables are at the
01281   // start, i.e. look for unbounded variables not included in `nub'. we can
01282   // potentially push up `nub' this way and get a bigger initial factorization.
01283   // note that when we swap rows/cols here we must not just swap row pointers,
01284   // as the initial factorization relies on the data being all in one chunk.
01285   // variables that have findex >= 0 are *not* considered to be unbounded even
01286   // if lo=-inf and hi=inf - this is because these limits may change during the
01287   // solution process.
01288 
01289   {
01290     int *findex = m_findex;
01291     btScalar *lo = m_lo, *hi = m_hi;
01292     const int n = m_n;
01293     for (int k = m_nub; k<n; ++k) {
01294       if (findex && findex[k] >= 0) continue;
01295       if (lo[k]==-BT_INFINITY && hi[k]==BT_INFINITY) {
01296         btSwapProblem (m_A,m_x,m_b,m_w,lo,hi,m_p,m_state,findex,n,m_nub,k,m_nskip,0);
01297         m_nub++;
01298       }
01299     }
01300   }
01301 
01302   // if there are unbounded variables at the start, factorize A up to that
01303   // point and solve for x. this puts all indexes 0..nub-1 into C.
01304   if (m_nub > 0) {
01305     const int nub = m_nub;
01306     {
01307       btScalar *Lrow = m_L;
01308       const int nskip = m_nskip;
01309       for (int j=0; j<nub; Lrow+=nskip, ++j) memcpy(Lrow,BTAROW(j),(j+1)*sizeof(btScalar));
01310     }
01311     btFactorLDLT (m_L,m_d,nub,m_nskip);
01312     memcpy (m_x,m_b,nub*sizeof(btScalar));
01313     btSolveLDLT (m_L,m_d,m_x,nub,m_nskip);
01314     btSetZero (m_w,nub);
01315     {
01316       int *C = m_C;
01317       for (int k=0; k<nub; ++k) C[k] = k;
01318     }
01319     m_nC = nub;
01320   }
01321 
01322   // permute the indexes > nub such that all findex variables are at the end
01323   if (m_findex) {
01324     const int nub = m_nub;
01325     int *findex = m_findex;
01326     int num_at_end = 0;
01327     for (int k=m_n-1; k >= nub; k--) {
01328       if (findex[k] >= 0) {
01329         btSwapProblem (m_A,m_x,m_b,m_w,m_lo,m_hi,m_p,m_state,findex,m_n,k,m_n-1-num_at_end,m_nskip,1);
01330         num_at_end++;
01331       }
01332     }
01333   }
01334 
01335   // print info about indexes
01336   /*
01337   {
01338     const int n = m_n;
01339     const int nub = m_nub;
01340     for (int k=0; k<n; k++) {
01341       if (k<nub) printf ("C");
01342       else if (m_lo[k]==-BT_INFINITY && m_hi[k]==BT_INFINITY) printf ("c");
01343       else printf (".");
01344     }
01345     printf ("\n");
01346   }
01347   */
01348 }
01349 
01350 
01351 void btLCP::transfer_i_to_C (int i)
01352 {
01353   {
01354     if (m_nC > 0) {
01355       // ell,Dell were computed by solve1(). note, ell = D \ L1solve (L,A(i,C))
01356       {
01357         const int nC = m_nC;
01358         btScalar *const Ltgt = m_L + nC*m_nskip, *ell = m_ell;
01359         for (int j=0; j<nC; ++j) Ltgt[j] = ell[j];
01360       }
01361       const int nC = m_nC;
01362       m_d[nC] = btRecip (BTAROW(i)[i] - btLargeDot(m_ell,m_Dell,nC));
01363     }
01364     else {
01365       m_d[0] = btRecip (BTAROW(i)[i]);
01366     }
01367 
01368     btSwapProblem (m_A,m_x,m_b,m_w,m_lo,m_hi,m_p,m_state,m_findex,m_n,m_nC,i,m_nskip,1);
01369 
01370     const int nC = m_nC;
01371     m_C[nC] = nC;
01372     m_nC = nC + 1; // nC value is outdated after this line
01373   }
01374 
01375 }
01376 
01377 
01378 void btLCP::transfer_i_from_N_to_C (int i)
01379 {
01380   {
01381     if (m_nC > 0) {
01382       {
01383         btScalar *const aptr = BTAROW(i);
01384         btScalar *Dell = m_Dell;
01385         const int *C = m_C;
01386 #   ifdef BTNUB_OPTIMIZATIONS
01387         // if nub>0, initial part of aptr unpermuted
01388         const int nub = m_nub;
01389         int j=0;
01390         for ( ; j<nub; ++j) Dell[j] = aptr[j];
01391         const int nC = m_nC;
01392         for ( ; j<nC; ++j) Dell[j] = aptr[C[j]];
01393 #   else
01394         const int nC = m_nC;
01395         for (int j=0; j<nC; ++j) Dell[j] = aptr[C[j]];
01396 #   endif
01397       }
01398       btSolveL1 (m_L,m_Dell,m_nC,m_nskip);
01399       {
01400         const int nC = m_nC;
01401         btScalar *const Ltgt = m_L + nC*m_nskip;
01402         btScalar *ell = m_ell, *Dell = m_Dell, *d = m_d;
01403         for (int j=0; j<nC; ++j) Ltgt[j] = ell[j] = Dell[j] * d[j];
01404       }
01405       const int nC = m_nC;
01406       m_d[nC] = btRecip (BTAROW(i)[i] - btLargeDot(m_ell,m_Dell,nC));
01407     }
01408     else {
01409       m_d[0] = btRecip (BTAROW(i)[i]);
01410     }
01411 
01412     btSwapProblem (m_A,m_x,m_b,m_w,m_lo,m_hi,m_p,m_state,m_findex,m_n,m_nC,i,m_nskip,1);
01413 
01414     const int nC = m_nC;
01415     m_C[nC] = nC;
01416     m_nN--;
01417     m_nC = nC + 1; // nC value is outdated after this line
01418   }
01419 
01420   // @@@ TO DO LATER
01421   // if we just finish here then we'll go back and re-solve for
01422   // delta_x. but actually we can be more efficient and incrementally
01423   // update delta_x here. but if we do this, we wont have ell and Dell
01424   // to use in updating the factorization later.
01425 
01426 }
01427 
01428 void btRemoveRowCol (btScalar *A, int n, int nskip, int r)
01429 {
01430   btAssert(A && n > 0 && nskip >= n && r >= 0 && r < n);
01431   if (r >= n-1) return;
01432   if (r > 0) {
01433     {
01434       const size_t move_size = (n-r-1)*sizeof(btScalar);
01435       btScalar *Adst = A + r;
01436       for (int i=0; i<r; Adst+=nskip,++i) {
01437         btScalar *Asrc = Adst + 1;
01438         memmove (Adst,Asrc,move_size);
01439       }
01440     }
01441     {
01442       const size_t cpy_size = r*sizeof(btScalar);
01443       btScalar *Adst = A + r * nskip;
01444       for (int i=r; i<(n-1); ++i) {
01445         btScalar *Asrc = Adst + nskip;
01446         memcpy (Adst,Asrc,cpy_size);
01447         Adst = Asrc;
01448       }
01449     }
01450   }
01451   {
01452     const size_t cpy_size = (n-r-1)*sizeof(btScalar);
01453     btScalar *Adst = A + r * (nskip + 1);
01454     for (int i=r; i<(n-1); ++i) {
01455       btScalar *Asrc = Adst + (nskip + 1);
01456       memcpy (Adst,Asrc,cpy_size);
01457       Adst = Asrc - 1;
01458     }
01459   }
01460 }
01461 
01462 
01463 
01464 
01465 void btLDLTAddTL (btScalar *L, btScalar *d, const btScalar *a, int n, int nskip, btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar>& scratch)
01466 {
01467   btAssert (L && d && a && n > 0 && nskip >= n);
01468 
01469   if (n < 2) return;
01470   scratch.resize(2*nskip);
01471   btScalar *W1 = &scratch[0];
01472   
01473   btScalar *W2 = W1 + nskip;
01474 
01475   W1[0] = btScalar(0.0);
01476   W2[0] = btScalar(0.0);
01477   for (int j=1; j<n; ++j) {
01478     W1[j] = W2[j] = (btScalar) (a[j] * SIMDSQRT12);
01479   }
01480   btScalar W11 = (btScalar) ((btScalar(0.5)*a[0]+1)*SIMDSQRT12);
01481   btScalar W21 = (btScalar) ((btScalar(0.5)*a[0]-1)*SIMDSQRT12);
01482 
01483   btScalar alpha1 = btScalar(1.0);
01484   btScalar alpha2 = btScalar(1.0);
01485 
01486   {
01487     btScalar dee = d[0];
01488     btScalar alphanew = alpha1 + (W11*W11)*dee;
01489     btAssert(alphanew != btScalar(0.0));
01490     dee /= alphanew;
01491     btScalar gamma1 = W11 * dee;
01492     dee *= alpha1;
01493     alpha1 = alphanew;
01494     alphanew = alpha2 - (W21*W21)*dee;
01495     dee /= alphanew;
01496     //btScalar gamma2 = W21 * dee;
01497     alpha2 = alphanew;
01498     btScalar k1 = btScalar(1.0) - W21*gamma1;
01499     btScalar k2 = W21*gamma1*W11 - W21;
01500     btScalar *ll = L + nskip;
01501     for (int p=1; p<n; ll+=nskip, ++p) {
01502       btScalar Wp = W1[p];
01503       btScalar ell = *ll;
01504       W1[p] =    Wp - W11*ell;
01505       W2[p] = k1*Wp +  k2*ell;
01506     }
01507   }
01508 
01509   btScalar *ll = L + (nskip + 1);
01510   for (int j=1; j<n; ll+=nskip+1, ++j) {
01511     btScalar k1 = W1[j];
01512     btScalar k2 = W2[j];
01513 
01514     btScalar dee = d[j];
01515     btScalar alphanew = alpha1 + (k1*k1)*dee;
01516     btAssert(alphanew != btScalar(0.0));
01517     dee /= alphanew;
01518     btScalar gamma1 = k1 * dee;
01519     dee *= alpha1;
01520     alpha1 = alphanew;
01521     alphanew = alpha2 - (k2*k2)*dee;
01522     dee /= alphanew;
01523     btScalar gamma2 = k2 * dee;
01524     dee *= alpha2;
01525     d[j] = dee;
01526     alpha2 = alphanew;
01527 
01528     btScalar *l = ll + nskip;
01529     for (int p=j+1; p<n; l+=nskip, ++p) {
01530       btScalar ell = *l;
01531       btScalar Wp = W1[p] - k1 * ell;
01532       ell += gamma1 * Wp;
01533       W1[p] = Wp;
01534       Wp = W2[p] - k2 * ell;
01535       ell -= gamma2 * Wp;
01536       W2[p] = Wp;
01537       *l = ell;
01538     }
01539   }
01540 }
01541 
01542 
01543 #define _BTGETA(i,j) (A[i][j])
01544 //#define _GETA(i,j) (A[(i)*nskip+(j)])
01545 #define BTGETA(i,j) ((i > j) ? _BTGETA(i,j) : _BTGETA(j,i))
01546 
01547 inline size_t btEstimateLDLTAddTLTmpbufSize(int nskip)
01548 {
01549   return nskip * 2 * sizeof(btScalar);
01550 }
01551 
01552 
01553 void btLDLTRemove (btScalar **A, const int *p, btScalar *L, btScalar *d,
01554     int n1, int n2, int r, int nskip, btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar>& scratch)
01555 {
01556   btAssert(A && p && L && d && n1 > 0 && n2 > 0 && r >= 0 && r < n2 &&
01557            n1 >= n2 && nskip >= n1);
01558   #ifdef BT_DEBUG
01559         for (int i=0; i<n2; ++i) 
01560                 btAssert(p[i] >= 0 && p[i] < n1);
01561   #endif
01562 
01563   if (r==n2-1) {
01564     return;             // deleting last row/col is easy
01565   }
01566   else {
01567     size_t LDLTAddTL_size = btEstimateLDLTAddTLTmpbufSize(nskip);
01568     btAssert(LDLTAddTL_size % sizeof(btScalar) == 0);
01569         scratch.resize(nskip * 2+n2);
01570     btScalar *tmp = &scratch[0];
01571     if (r==0) {
01572       btScalar *a = (btScalar *)((char *)tmp + LDLTAddTL_size);
01573       const int p_0 = p[0];
01574       for (int i=0; i<n2; ++i) {
01575         a[i] = -BTGETA(p[i],p_0);
01576       }
01577       a[0] += btScalar(1.0);
01578       btLDLTAddTL (L,d,a,n2,nskip,scratch);
01579     }
01580     else {
01581       btScalar *t = (btScalar *)((char *)tmp + LDLTAddTL_size);
01582       {
01583         btScalar *Lcurr = L + r*nskip;
01584         for (int i=0; i<r; ++Lcurr, ++i) {
01585           btAssert(d[i] != btScalar(0.0));
01586           t[i] = *Lcurr / d[i];
01587         }
01588       }
01589       btScalar *a = t + r;
01590       {
01591         btScalar *Lcurr = L + r*nskip;
01592         const int *pp_r = p + r, p_r = *pp_r;
01593         const int n2_minus_r = n2-r;
01594         for (int i=0; i<n2_minus_r; Lcurr+=nskip,++i) {
01595           a[i] = btLargeDot(Lcurr,t,r) - BTGETA(pp_r[i],p_r);
01596         }
01597       }
01598       a[0] += btScalar(1.0);
01599       btLDLTAddTL (L + r*nskip+r, d+r, a, n2-r, nskip, scratch);
01600     }
01601   }
01602 
01603   // snip out row/column r from L and d
01604   btRemoveRowCol (L,n2,nskip,r);
01605   if (r < (n2-1)) memmove (d+r,d+r+1,(n2-r-1)*sizeof(btScalar));
01606 }
01607 
01608 
01609 void btLCP::transfer_i_from_C_to_N (int i, btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar>& scratch)
01610 {
01611   {
01612     int *C = m_C;
01613     // remove a row/column from the factorization, and adjust the
01614     // indexes (black magic!)
01615     int last_idx = -1;
01616     const int nC = m_nC;
01617     int j = 0;
01618     for ( ; j<nC; ++j) {
01619       if (C[j]==nC-1) {
01620         last_idx = j;
01621       }
01622       if (C[j]==i) {
01623         btLDLTRemove (m_A,C,m_L,m_d,m_n,nC,j,m_nskip,scratch);
01624         int k;
01625         if (last_idx == -1) {
01626           for (k=j+1 ; k<nC; ++k) {
01627             if (C[k]==nC-1) {
01628               break;
01629             }
01630           }
01631           btAssert (k < nC);
01632         }
01633         else {
01634           k = last_idx;
01635         }
01636         C[k] = C[j];
01637         if (j < (nC-1)) memmove (C+j,C+j+1,(nC-j-1)*sizeof(int));
01638         break;
01639       }
01640     }
01641     btAssert (j < nC);
01642 
01643     btSwapProblem (m_A,m_x,m_b,m_w,m_lo,m_hi,m_p,m_state,m_findex,m_n,i,nC-1,m_nskip,1);
01644 
01645     m_nN++;
01646     m_nC = nC - 1; // nC value is outdated after this line
01647   }
01648 
01649 }
01650 
01651 
01652 void btLCP::pN_equals_ANC_times_qC (btScalar *p, btScalar *q)
01653 {
01654   // we could try to make this matrix-vector multiplication faster using
01655   // outer product matrix tricks, e.g. with the dMultidotX() functions.
01656   // but i tried it and it actually made things slower on random 100x100
01657   // problems because of the overhead involved. so we'll stick with the
01658   // simple method for now.
01659   const int nC = m_nC;
01660   btScalar *ptgt = p + nC;
01661   const int nN = m_nN;
01662   for (int i=0; i<nN; ++i) {
01663     ptgt[i] = btLargeDot (BTAROW(i+nC),q,nC);
01664   }
01665 }
01666 
01667 
01668 void btLCP::pN_plusequals_ANi (btScalar *p, int i, int sign)
01669 {
01670   const int nC = m_nC;
01671   btScalar *aptr = BTAROW(i) + nC;
01672   btScalar *ptgt = p + nC;
01673   if (sign > 0) {
01674     const int nN = m_nN;
01675     for (int j=0; j<nN; ++j) ptgt[j] += aptr[j];
01676   }
01677   else {
01678     const int nN = m_nN;
01679     for (int j=0; j<nN; ++j) ptgt[j] -= aptr[j];
01680   }
01681 }
01682 
01683 void btLCP::pC_plusequals_s_times_qC (btScalar *p, btScalar s, btScalar *q)
01684 {
01685   const int nC = m_nC;
01686   for (int i=0; i<nC; ++i) {
01687     p[i] += s*q[i];
01688   }
01689 }
01690 
01691 void btLCP::pN_plusequals_s_times_qN (btScalar *p, btScalar s, btScalar *q)
01692 {
01693   const int nC = m_nC;
01694   btScalar *ptgt = p + nC, *qsrc = q + nC;
01695   const int nN = m_nN;
01696   for (int i=0; i<nN; ++i) {
01697     ptgt[i] += s*qsrc[i];
01698   }
01699 }
01700 
01701 void btLCP::solve1 (btScalar *a, int i, int dir, int only_transfer)
01702 {
01703   // the `Dell' and `ell' that are computed here are saved. if index i is
01704   // later added to the factorization then they can be reused.
01705   //
01706   // @@@ question: do we need to solve for entire delta_x??? yes, but
01707   //     only if an x goes below 0 during the step.
01708 
01709   if (m_nC > 0) {
01710     {
01711       btScalar *Dell = m_Dell;
01712       int *C = m_C;
01713       btScalar *aptr = BTAROW(i);
01714 #   ifdef BTNUB_OPTIMIZATIONS
01715       // if nub>0, initial part of aptr[] is guaranteed unpermuted
01716       const int nub = m_nub;
01717       int j=0;
01718       for ( ; j<nub; ++j) Dell[j] = aptr[j];
01719       const int nC = m_nC;
01720       for ( ; j<nC; ++j) Dell[j] = aptr[C[j]];
01721 #   else
01722       const int nC = m_nC;
01723       for (int j=0; j<nC; ++j) Dell[j] = aptr[C[j]];
01724 #   endif
01725     }
01726     btSolveL1 (m_L,m_Dell,m_nC,m_nskip);
01727     {
01728       btScalar *ell = m_ell, *Dell = m_Dell, *d = m_d;
01729       const int nC = m_nC;
01730       for (int j=0; j<nC; ++j) ell[j] = Dell[j] * d[j];
01731     }
01732 
01733     if (!only_transfer) {
01734       btScalar *tmp = m_tmp, *ell = m_ell;
01735       {
01736         const int nC = m_nC;
01737         for (int j=0; j<nC; ++j) tmp[j] = ell[j];
01738       }
01739       btSolveL1T (m_L,tmp,m_nC,m_nskip);
01740       if (dir > 0) {
01741         int *C = m_C;
01742         btScalar *tmp = m_tmp;
01743         const int nC = m_nC;
01744         for (int j=0; j<nC; ++j) a[C[j]] = -tmp[j];
01745       } else {
01746         int *C = m_C;
01747         btScalar *tmp = m_tmp;
01748         const int nC = m_nC;
01749         for (int j=0; j<nC; ++j) a[C[j]] = tmp[j];
01750       }
01751     }
01752   }
01753 }
01754 
01755 
01756 void btLCP::unpermute()
01757 {
01758   // now we have to un-permute x and w
01759   {
01760     memcpy (m_tmp,m_x,m_n*sizeof(btScalar));
01761     btScalar *x = m_x, *tmp = m_tmp;
01762     const int *p = m_p;
01763     const int n = m_n;
01764     for (int j=0; j<n; ++j) x[p[j]] = tmp[j];
01765   }
01766   {
01767     memcpy (m_tmp,m_w,m_n*sizeof(btScalar));
01768     btScalar *w = m_w, *tmp = m_tmp;
01769     const int *p = m_p;
01770     const int n = m_n;
01771     for (int j=0; j<n; ++j) w[p[j]] = tmp[j];
01772   }
01773 }
01774 
01775 #endif // btLCP_FAST
01776 
01777 
01778 //***************************************************************************
01779 // an optimized Dantzig LCP driver routine for the lo-hi LCP problem.
01780 
01781 bool btSolveDantzigLCP (int n, btScalar *A, btScalar *x, btScalar *b,
01782                 btScalar* outer_w, int nub, btScalar *lo, btScalar *hi, int *findex, btDantzigScratchMemory& scratchMem)
01783 {
01784         s_error = false;
01785 
01786 //      printf("btSolveDantzigLCP n=%d\n",n);
01787   btAssert (n>0 && A && x && b && lo && hi && nub >= 0 && nub <= n);
01788   btAssert(outer_w);
01789 
01790 #ifdef BT_DEBUG
01791   {
01792     // check restrictions on lo and hi
01793     for (int k=0; k<n; ++k) 
01794                 btAssert (lo[k] <= 0 && hi[k] >= 0);
01795   }
01796 # endif
01797 
01798 
01799   // if all the variables are unbounded then we can just factor, solve,
01800   // and return
01801   if (nub >= n) 
01802   {
01803    
01804 
01805     int nskip = (n);
01806     btFactorLDLT (A, outer_w, n, nskip);
01807     btSolveLDLT (A, outer_w, b, n, nskip);
01808     memcpy (x, b, n*sizeof(btScalar));
01809 
01810     return !s_error;
01811   }
01812 
01813   const int nskip = (n);
01814   scratchMem.L.resize(n*nskip);
01815 
01816   scratchMem.d.resize(n);
01817 
01818   btScalar *w = outer_w;
01819   scratchMem.delta_w.resize(n);
01820   scratchMem.delta_x.resize(n);
01821   scratchMem.Dell.resize(n);
01822   scratchMem.ell.resize(n);
01823   scratchMem.Arows.resize(n);
01824   scratchMem.p.resize(n);
01825   scratchMem.C.resize(n);
01826 
01827   // for i in N, state[i] is 0 if x(i)==lo(i) or 1 if x(i)==hi(i)
01828   scratchMem.state.resize(n);
01829 
01830 
01831   // create LCP object. note that tmp is set to delta_w to save space, this
01832   // optimization relies on knowledge of how tmp is used, so be careful!
01833   btLCP lcp(n,nskip,nub,A,x,b,w,lo,hi,&scratchMem.L[0],&scratchMem.d[0],&scratchMem.Dell[0],&scratchMem.ell[0],&scratchMem.delta_w[0],&scratchMem.state[0],findex,&scratchMem.p[0],&scratchMem.C[0],&scratchMem.Arows[0]);
01834   int adj_nub = lcp.getNub();
01835 
01836   // loop over all indexes adj_nub..n-1. for index i, if x(i),w(i) satisfy the
01837   // LCP conditions then i is added to the appropriate index set. otherwise
01838   // x(i),w(i) is driven either +ve or -ve to force it to the valid region.
01839   // as we drive x(i), x(C) is also adjusted to keep w(C) at zero.
01840   // while driving x(i) we maintain the LCP conditions on the other variables
01841   // 0..i-1. we do this by watching out for other x(i),w(i) values going
01842   // outside the valid region, and then switching them between index sets
01843   // when that happens.
01844 
01845   bool hit_first_friction_index = false;
01846   for (int i=adj_nub; i<n; ++i) 
01847   {
01848     s_error = false;
01849     // the index i is the driving index and indexes i+1..n-1 are "dont care",
01850     // i.e. when we make changes to the system those x's will be zero and we
01851     // don't care what happens to those w's. in other words, we only consider
01852     // an (i+1)*(i+1) sub-problem of A*x=b+w.
01853 
01854     // if we've hit the first friction index, we have to compute the lo and
01855     // hi values based on the values of x already computed. we have been
01856     // permuting the indexes, so the values stored in the findex vector are
01857     // no longer valid. thus we have to temporarily unpermute the x vector. 
01858     // for the purposes of this computation, 0*infinity = 0 ... so if the
01859     // contact constraint's normal force is 0, there should be no tangential
01860     // force applied.
01861 
01862     if (!hit_first_friction_index && findex && findex[i] >= 0) {
01863       // un-permute x into delta_w, which is not being used at the moment
01864       for (int j=0; j<n; ++j) scratchMem.delta_w[scratchMem.p[j]] = x[j];
01865 
01866       // set lo and hi values
01867       for (int k=i; k<n; ++k) {
01868         btScalar wfk = scratchMem.delta_w[findex[k]];
01869         if (wfk == 0) {
01870           hi[k] = 0;
01871           lo[k] = 0;
01872         }
01873         else {
01874           hi[k] = btFabs (hi[k] * wfk);
01875           lo[k] = -hi[k];
01876         }
01877       }
01878       hit_first_friction_index = true;
01879     }
01880 
01881     // thus far we have not even been computing the w values for indexes
01882     // greater than i, so compute w[i] now.
01883     w[i] = lcp.AiC_times_qC (i,x) + lcp.AiN_times_qN (i,x) - b[i];
01884 
01885     // if lo=hi=0 (which can happen for tangential friction when normals are
01886     // 0) then the index will be assigned to set N with some state. however,
01887     // set C's line has zero size, so the index will always remain in set N.
01888     // with the "normal" switching logic, if w changed sign then the index
01889     // would have to switch to set C and then back to set N with an inverted
01890     // state. this is pointless, and also computationally expensive. to
01891     // prevent this from happening, we use the rule that indexes with lo=hi=0
01892     // will never be checked for set changes. this means that the state for
01893     // these indexes may be incorrect, but that doesn't matter.
01894 
01895     // see if x(i),w(i) is in a valid region
01896     if (lo[i]==0 && w[i] >= 0) {
01897       lcp.transfer_i_to_N (i);
01898       scratchMem.state[i] = false;
01899     }
01900     else if (hi[i]==0 && w[i] <= 0) {
01901       lcp.transfer_i_to_N (i);
01902       scratchMem.state[i] = true;
01903     }
01904     else if (w[i]==0) {
01905       // this is a degenerate case. by the time we get to this test we know
01906       // that lo != 0, which means that lo < 0 as lo is not allowed to be +ve,
01907       // and similarly that hi > 0. this means that the line segment
01908       // corresponding to set C is at least finite in extent, and we are on it.
01909       // NOTE: we must call lcp.solve1() before lcp.transfer_i_to_C()
01910       lcp.solve1 (&scratchMem.delta_x[0],i,0,1);
01911 
01912       lcp.transfer_i_to_C (i);
01913     }
01914     else {
01915       // we must push x(i) and w(i)
01916       for (;;) {
01917         int dir;
01918         btScalar dirf;
01919         // find direction to push on x(i)
01920         if (w[i] <= 0) {
01921           dir = 1;
01922           dirf = btScalar(1.0);
01923         }
01924         else {
01925           dir = -1;
01926           dirf = btScalar(-1.0);
01927         }
01928 
01929         // compute: delta_x(C) = -dir*A(C,C)\A(C,i)
01930         lcp.solve1 (&scratchMem.delta_x[0],i,dir);
01931 
01932         // note that delta_x[i] = dirf, but we wont bother to set it
01933 
01934         // compute: delta_w = A*delta_x ... note we only care about
01935         // delta_w(N) and delta_w(i), the rest is ignored
01936         lcp.pN_equals_ANC_times_qC (&scratchMem.delta_w[0],&scratchMem.delta_x[0]);
01937         lcp.pN_plusequals_ANi (&scratchMem.delta_w[0],i,dir);
01938         scratchMem.delta_w[i] = lcp.AiC_times_qC (i,&scratchMem.delta_x[0]) + lcp.Aii(i)*dirf;
01939 
01940         // find largest step we can take (size=s), either to drive x(i),w(i)
01941         // to the valid LCP region or to drive an already-valid variable
01942         // outside the valid region.
01943 
01944         int cmd = 1;            // index switching command
01945         int si = 0;             // si = index to switch if cmd>3
01946         btScalar s = -w[i]/scratchMem.delta_w[i];
01947         if (dir > 0) {
01948           if (hi[i] < BT_INFINITY) {
01949             btScalar s2 = (hi[i]-x[i])*dirf;    // was (hi[i]-x[i])/dirf        // step to x(i)=hi(i)
01950             if (s2 < s) {
01951               s = s2;
01952               cmd = 3;
01953             }
01954           }
01955         }
01956         else {
01957           if (lo[i] > -BT_INFINITY) {
01958             btScalar s2 = (lo[i]-x[i])*dirf;    // was (lo[i]-x[i])/dirf        // step to x(i)=lo(i)
01959             if (s2 < s) {
01960               s = s2;
01961               cmd = 2;
01962             }
01963           }
01964         }
01965 
01966         {
01967           const int numN = lcp.numN();
01968           for (int k=0; k < numN; ++k) {
01969             const int indexN_k = lcp.indexN(k);
01970             if (!scratchMem.state[indexN_k] ? scratchMem.delta_w[indexN_k] < 0 : scratchMem.delta_w[indexN_k] > 0) {
01971                 // don't bother checking if lo=hi=0
01972                 if (lo[indexN_k] == 0 && hi[indexN_k] == 0) continue;
01973                 btScalar s2 = -w[indexN_k] / scratchMem.delta_w[indexN_k];
01974                 if (s2 < s) {
01975                   s = s2;
01976                   cmd = 4;
01977                   si = indexN_k;
01978                 }
01979             }
01980           }
01981         }
01982 
01983         {
01984           const int numC = lcp.numC();
01985           for (int k=adj_nub; k < numC; ++k) {
01986             const int indexC_k = lcp.indexC(k);
01987             if (scratchMem.delta_x[indexC_k] < 0 && lo[indexC_k] > -BT_INFINITY) {
01988               btScalar s2 = (lo[indexC_k]-x[indexC_k]) / scratchMem.delta_x[indexC_k];
01989               if (s2 < s) {
01990                 s = s2;
01991                 cmd = 5;
01992                 si = indexC_k;
01993               }
01994             }
01995             if (scratchMem.delta_x[indexC_k] > 0 && hi[indexC_k] < BT_INFINITY) {
01996               btScalar s2 = (hi[indexC_k]-x[indexC_k]) / scratchMem.delta_x[indexC_k];
01997               if (s2 < s) {
01998                 s = s2;
01999                 cmd = 6;
02000                 si = indexC_k;
02001               }
02002             }
02003           }
02004         }
02005 
02006         //static char* cmdstring[8] = {0,"->C","->NL","->NH","N->C",
02007         //                           "C->NL","C->NH"};
02008         //printf ("cmd=%d (%s), si=%d\n",cmd,cmdstring[cmd],(cmd>3) ? si : i);
02009 
02010         // if s <= 0 then we've got a problem. if we just keep going then
02011         // we're going to get stuck in an infinite loop. instead, just cross
02012         // our fingers and exit with the current solution.
02013         if (s <= btScalar(0.0)) 
02014                 {
02015 //          printf("LCP internal error, s <= 0 (s=%.4e)",(double)s);
02016           if (i < n) {
02017             btSetZero (x+i,n-i);
02018             btSetZero (w+i,n-i);
02019           }
02020           s_error = true;
02021           break;
02022         }
02023 
02024         // apply x = x + s * delta_x
02025         lcp.pC_plusequals_s_times_qC (x, s, &scratchMem.delta_x[0]);
02026         x[i] += s * dirf;
02027 
02028         // apply w = w + s * delta_w
02029         lcp.pN_plusequals_s_times_qN (w, s, &scratchMem.delta_w[0]);
02030         w[i] += s * scratchMem.delta_w[i];
02031 
02032 //        void *tmpbuf;
02033         // switch indexes between sets if necessary
02034         switch (cmd) {
02035         case 1:         // done
02036           w[i] = 0;
02037           lcp.transfer_i_to_C (i);
02038           break;
02039         case 2:         // done
02040           x[i] = lo[i];
02041           scratchMem.state[i] = false;
02042           lcp.transfer_i_to_N (i);
02043           break;
02044         case 3:         // done
02045           x[i] = hi[i];
02046           scratchMem.state[i] = true;
02047           lcp.transfer_i_to_N (i);
02048           break;
02049         case 4:         // keep going
02050           w[si] = 0;
02051           lcp.transfer_i_from_N_to_C (si);
02052           break;
02053         case 5:         // keep going
02054           x[si] = lo[si];
02055           scratchMem.state[si] = false;
02056                   lcp.transfer_i_from_C_to_N (si, scratchMem.m_scratch);
02057           break;
02058         case 6:         // keep going
02059           x[si] = hi[si];
02060           scratchMem.state[si] = true;
02061           lcp.transfer_i_from_C_to_N (si, scratchMem.m_scratch);
02062           break;
02063         }
02064 
02065         if (cmd <= 3) break;
02066       } // for (;;)
02067     } // else
02068 
02069     if (s_error) 
02070         {
02071       break;
02072     }
02073   } // for (int i=adj_nub; i<n; ++i)
02074 
02075   lcp.unpermute();
02076 
02077 
02078   return !s_error;
02079 }
